intro: Perymenium chihuahuense, commonly known as the Chihuahua perymenium, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in a composite head. Perymenium chihuahuense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
